summary:
Conjunctivitis, or pink eye, is when your eye's white part and inner eyelid get swollen and look pink or red. It can cause pain, itching, or tears. You might wake up with your eye stuck shut. It can affect one or both eyes and is common in kids and adults.

It can be caused by viruses, bacteria, or allergies. You can catch it from others easily. Treatment depends on the cause. Sometimes, it goes away on its own. Antibiotics can help with bacterial infections. Allergy medicine can help with itchy eyes. It's important to wash your hands to prevent spreading it.
title: Conjunctivitis
